answers.answer: Hello,Cherry angiomas are benign lesions and are not skin cancer but the sudden appearance of multiple cutaneous lesions always should raise concerns that the lesions may accompany the development of an internal malignancy. Also sometimes malinomas may resemble cherry hamangiomas and so biopsy should always be done for suspicious looking lesions.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your dermatologist. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I am 41  and i have had some cherry hemiangiomas all my life.. i asked my gyno when i saw her if there was anything to worry about.  that was nov.  I have  noticed i have more popping up on my arms and by body... I have looked them up and some medical websites say there may be  internal malingancies... so my question is there anything to  worry about.?  what is causes these?  what does septa mean when used with them? do i need to worry about skin cancer or any other kind of cancer? Like all of us in the 80's i spent my share out in the sun.. getting a tan..(with tanning oil instead of suncreen) I really need an answer...here is some historymom had heart attack in late 30's and died of breast cancer complications at late 50'sgrandma on mom  uterine cancer(died of alzheimers related problems)grandma on dad   skin cancer on some of face due to excessive sun exposure... died 98 old agedad died of lung cancer spread to brain at 50'si have.. asthma(controlled), high blood pressure (controlled benicarhct 75mg 1xday), high cholesterol(simaversteran 20mg 1xday), diabetes (metformin 500 mg 1xday.#s 115-153... and 160-300 when on steroids for asthma related problems..... diagnosed last june.).. i also take effexor 220mg 1xday depression...Any advice or help is greatly appreciated... thank you in advancegeneva
title: cherry hemianiomas
